sentences.sContent: All this, needless to say, had been culled second-hand from radio reports.
sentences.sCn: 不必说，这一切都是从无线电广播报道中搜集来的第二手信息。

sentences.sContent: In the reserves of Zimbabwe and South Africa, annual culls are already routine.
sentences.sCn: 在津巴布韦和南非的自然保护区，对病弱动物每年所进行的宰杀剔除已成惯例。

remMethod.val: 斗牛用的公牛 (bull) 要精选 (cull)

trans.tranOther: If items or ideas are culled from a particular source or number of sources, they are taken and gathered together

trans.tranCn: 剔出来杀掉的动物；拣出的等外品
